intro: Peucedanum uhligii, commonly known as the Himalayan cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems and compound leaves with a distinct, fern-like appearance. Its small white or greenish flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Peucedanum uhligii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in alpine gardens.
